info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms in Bay, Saginaw and Midland Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Edenville to near Pleasant Valley to near St. Charles. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St. Charles around 635 PM EDT. Bridgeport around 655 PM EDT. Midland, Pinconning, Freeland and Linwood around 705 PM EDT. Birch Run and Kawkawlin around 710 PM EDT. Frankenmuth and Auburn around 715 PM EDT. Zilwaukee around 725 PM EDT. Saginaw, Bay City, Essexville and Munger around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Carrollton, Garfield, Arthur, Fenmore, Crump, Buena Vista Township, Gera, Indiantown, Bombay and Hemlock. People attending Saginaw African Cultural Festival, Saginaw Art Fair, and Summer Music Fest should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
